title: Why am I still here.. (Japan Update)

comments.comment: The whole situation seems super frustrating, I really hope things start changing soon
I am in precisely the same situation as you, and it is extremely frustrating. Was meant to have moved two years ago, right around the start of the pandemic. Really hope it opens back up soon…

It’s nice to finally here someone talk about it that understands the feelings. I’ve been trying to move there for more than a year as a student and have already paid my tuition and taken 4hr long intensive classes everyday after working full time to learn the language before I go. I’ve had to give up a really good job, sell my car, and a multitude of people asking “I thought you were moving to Japan?” And scariest part is giving up on Japan after all of this and then have it open up after I give up, the constant juggle of decisions in this limbo is beyond stressful
I feel your pain Felix, I was going to move there in 2011... Fukushima happened... I was going to try in again in 2020.... Covid happened... it is almost like a sick game the universe plays.
I'm so proud that he never stopped being humble. Seriously.

Mate I can't begin to imagine how frustrating this must have been. 
Being in Japan has always felt like being in a bubble, but never more so than the last two years. The sad truth is because the foreign population makes up just 2% of the population, the ruthless border controls don't really impact the vast majority of people living here and so the government is able to make decisions and not really factor the foreign population into it (like when they banned even foreign residents of Japan from being able to travel here in 2020). I'm often asked for predictions on when it'll re-open to folks with visas such as yourself, but unfortunately I suspect the new variant has really pushed it down the road by another 3 - 5 months at this point.
Japan has to be one of the hardest countries to move to, nevermind in the middle of a pandemic. It must be insanely stressful, hopefully things clear up soon

I love how self aware he is, I dont like using the word humble because it just sounds cringe but felix has not let fame and money cloud his personality and ethics. The fact that he even feels guilty about explaining his home situation shows how socially conscious he is despite his success.
Balancing “giving up” and “keep on going” is so difficult, you’re not alone there

Regardless of the situation,  we are all still very proud of you and love you, Felix. And we're always with you, Pewd's <3

One of the students who can't enter here. Saved up for 4 years to study in japan and since I already paid tuition I now get to study online in Japan from outside of Japan. Makes me feel like I've said no to so many great opportunities for the last 4 years for absolutely nothing. I just hope they will soon let the students enter again because studying with such a time difference is pretty rough on the mind. Hope you can enter soon too felix!

Felix just because you are “well off” doesn’t mean you can’t talk about something affecting you. You are human and your message is super relatable and may make them feel better

I was studying in Japan when the pandemic broke out. I was visiting home because a family member had passed away when they closed the borders and all flights got cancelled. After a 3 month strict lockdown the restrictions to enter Japan had toughened and I couldn't fly back. All of my stuff was left in the literal other side of the world and I could not even get back in the country to pick them up, and that also meant I still had to pay rent because my things were still in the apartment. After a couple of months a friend managed to send me most of my things, but there's still money for a whole semester on my japanese bank account I can't access from overseas and my residence card is now expired so I can't get in under the exceptions. It's not just that the borders have been closed for so long, it also feels like they've been trying to make things as difficult as possible. 

I of course had to cancel the second part of the exchange and missed a semester. This forced me to take an extra year to finish my degree. I can understand your frustration because I remember being so excited to know you were moving to Tokyo when I was there too, and I thought I was so lucky because of that. Here we are now two years later :-) I really hope this gets sorted soon, even though it doesn't look too good. Sending you the best

You're not being entitled at all, it's totally okay to talk about what you've been through. It sounds really frustrating especially it's been two years and in the middle of a pandemic. We're rooting for you Pewds! Hoping your situation improves in no time!

I’m a Japanese living in Tokyo. According to a statement from the Japanese prime minister, the government is now considering easing the tight entry restrictions for new foreign arrivals. I’m so sorry for the struggles that you’ve been through about this. I sincerely hope that you and your family can safely move to Japan soon!! I can’t wait to see your videos filmed in Japan!

THANK YOU, FELIX! I'm a university student still stuck outside of Japan, it's nice to know you're talking about the issue. My classes are from 7 pm to around 5 am some days and it's incredibly frustrating.

No don't feel entitled. One thing we love as subscribers is being able to see where your walks in life are (If you allow them) and we really appreciate being part of that long frustrating journey with you. We hope for the best!

I'm one of those students who has been unable to get into Japan for almost two years. My exchange programme is due in March and I honestly don't know if I can enter Japan for at least a couple of weeks after two years of online classes. Many of us have had to get up at 2-3am just to listen to zoom lectures, and for those who are self-funded (not educational grants) this is a huge loss. Thank you very much for covering this topic. People who wrote to you didn't expect the Japanese government to suddenly change its bizarre decisions, but to see the support from major youtuber is great. Really moved to tears that finally we have been heard outside our bubble and more people will known about this mess

I grew up in Japan my whole life, until I was 18. It is incredibly difficult to get into Japan, my family are Permanent residents (Special Status) and its super difficult for even me to get back home to my parents and older sister who are still there. I hope to see you back in Japan bro. Subscriber since like 2011 or earlier even. One love

As someone who’s been in Japan for the entirety of the lockdown this is all so valid. But sometimes I miss home. I haven’t seen my family for the holidays in two years.
This is why felix is still here after all these years. Money hasn't changed him a bit and he is so humble. Massive respect

Coming back here, after you've successfully moved to Japan. Congrats Felix!!!

Totally justified in venting a little bit! It's refreshing to actually hear that we're all sorta frustrated with the situation to varying levels.
Maybe it won't help the main situation but it's nice to sorta be in it together, trying to travel aborad and what not.

Hang in there man! Trying to stay optimistic for 2022 for things to turn around!
Felix, you're allowed to vent. Everyone, no matter how well off they are, has feelings and frustrations, and it's all valid. Vent away, friend. We gotchu.

you are not alone on this! it’s not lame talking about this on YT, i’m relieved i’m not alone either. just last night i was researching when Japan would open its borders… and i do this weekly. my fiancé is Japanese and lives in Japan and we have been patiently waiting almost 2 years now for the borders to open so i can go to him. our relationship is at a point where we need that for us to grow and decide if i will move there myself. long distance is okay, but not forever. we’re both eager and the anticipation is overflowing. i am hoping and praying they open at least around summertime since sakura season is too optimistic… but i hope soon… many of us have halted our plans, some more serious than others since yours revolves around moving there, which is HUGE and you’ve waited TOO long! i understand the frustration! i’m praying for the best and hoping for it to open in the first half of 2022. best of luck Pewds <3

This video is much appreciated Felix, as I am in the same situation. Going to work in Japan has been a dream of mine for a long time, and after my MA in Japanese studies I finally found a job as an English teacher, almost two years ago now. I was approved when the pandemic just started. I was 27, now I'm 29, waiting for news but constantly frustrated because of no updates at all. When there is even a small chance Japan would reopen, they announce that they're closing again. I'm getting older and I feel like my life has been on hold for two years now because I planned on going to Japan for a few years (my visa would be 3 years, extendable) and then coming back home to settle in with my boyfriend. Everyone keeps asking me: "so when are you going to Japan" and at that point all I can say is: "I wish I knew". At this point it's ridiculous because I've waited that long that it would be bad to give up, but at the same time I can wait much longer as my life needs to go on. Hopefully we'll get an update soon and we'll be able to enter Japan by half 2022, although at this point my hopes are very low.  I don't know if Japan is taking the right approach to this situation, but I'm sure there are other ways to deal with that, like allowing students and workers in, for a change.
It's like moving files to another folder but the loading bar gets stuck on 99% for 3 years but you can't bring yourself to cancel it just in case it completes any second

Whether you're rich or poor, you're still human and allowed to talk about the things that are upsetting you. I really hope you guys get to move soon!

Yo Felix I'm so happy you shared your side of the story about this issue. So I kept postponing and postponing until 2 years went by and I just had to give up, because I couldn't postpone my graduation anymore. I was so so bummed out because I was so close to living the dream, I really understand you and Marzia's frustration with the whole closed borders situation and Japan hardly ever giving any news updates on it. Well, Pewds...different point of view. Moved to Japan two years ago before they closed the borders. It's been a crazy up and down over here as well...and the thought of not seeing your family in person for two years, because you exactly know, when you leave the country, you're not allowed to enter Japan again...except you are Japanese (even not being vaccinated), is deeply depressing.
As long as you are a foreigner, you are on the wrong side. :'D
A friend of mine is married to a Japanese woman, they have kids together, live in Europe...he got the shot, she didn't. Guess who was allowed to go to Japan for the summer holidays?
She, and their kids. He wasn't. That's the way it is. And that's the way how Japan survived hundreds of years ago. The longer I stay here, the more I truly understand the way of thinking, which is really interesting.

With that said, you and Marzia will  move to Japan eventually, it is just not the right time yet. Also, sure, it's nice to be here, but when there are restrictions everywhere, and you're just ending up going to work, buying groceries, always wearing a mask, and staying at home, because of all that...that's not the life you dreamed off, while being here. :*

And I don't think you're complaining at all, you're just pointing out problems of being a foreigner, trying to live in Japan. :)
